value.name: New political system poses great danger - Wigley
value.description: A reform of Wales' political system poses "a very great danger", a former leader of Plaid Cymru has said.Dafydd Wigley was reacting to plans to bring in a so-called closed list PR system for Cardiff Bay from 2026.

value.description: Plans to reform social care and House of Lords are trimmed as Keir Starmer’s party opts for caution ahead of vote

value.name: David Cameron is no threat to Rishi Sunak
value.description: In the latest Sisyphean effort to stabilise his government, Rishi Sunak abandoned his pledge to be the change agent from “the 30-year political status quo” by signing up the man who had been prime minister for seven of those years.

value.name: Moment TV host quits live on air and declares ‘I’m off to fight Putin’
value.description: At the end of his news programme Window and Facts, Orest Drymalovsky, 29, told ICTV viewers: ‘That’s all for now. And for me it’s a personal finish today. This was my last broadcast before I am mobilised to the Armed Forces of Ukraine .’

value.name: Government parties' MEPs pick opposing sides in Brussels row with big pharma over drug costs
value.description: MEPS FROM GOVERNMENT coalition parties have taken opposing sides in a row between Brussels and big pharma over plans to cut the price of medicines by reducing patent protection on new drugs, boosting access to cheaper generic medicines.

value.name: Argentina's lower chamber approves Milei's reform bill
value.description: The bill was approved in a vote of 144 in favor and 109 against, moving it to the next stage of voting in the Senate.

value.name: Renewed calls to pass rail safety reform one year after East Palestine train derailment
value.description: Shortly after the crash Senators from Ohio and Pennsylvania, both Democrats and Republicans, introduced a new bill to boost safety measures for trains carrying dangerous materials. It would create requirements for detectors that take the temperature of each railcar wheel as it passes. This was an issue in the East Palestine crash.

value.name: Remember the rules, liberals: Only the right gets to mock America
value.description: “Take a step back, be honest,” Dimon implored Americans without a hint of self-consciousness, during a Jan. 17 interview with CNBC from the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland. “Trump was kind of right about NATO," he continued, "kind of right about immigration. Tax reform worked.”

value.name: Argentine president's reforms pass first test in Congress
value.description: Argentine lawmakers took a first step Friday toward approving President Javier Milei's sweeping economic, social and political reform package, which has sparked angry opposition protests.But opposition deputy Leandro Santoro pointed to the economic and social crisis of 2001 as an example of the risks of free-market reforms.
